title: Mining of Quartz Deposits in Kotikambokka Forest of Wellawaya impacted due to the construction of the Alikota Ara Reservoir
decision_details: - It has been estimated that, the Quartz deposit located in a forest area belonging to the Department of Wildlife Conservation in Kotikambokka, Wellawaya, is in extent of approximately 910,000 Cubic Meters. Since the said Kotikambokka, Vein Quartz is located in the boundary of the Alikota Ara Reservoir which is being constructed under the Uma Oya Multi Purpose Development Scheme, it will be impossible to carry out proper mining of the deposit, when the reservoir is filled in with water at the end of year 2018, as stipulated. As such,  the proposal made by Maithripala Sirisena, H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to carryout  a formal feasibility study and on the results, to call for proposals  from local and international organizations following a transparent procedure for selecting a suitable organization to conduct scientific mining prior to filling the reservoir with water and to export the produce after value addition with the objective of getting a significant contribution to the National Economy, was approved by the Cabinet.
